docs.lead_paragraph: NORTH-BROOKLYN.--Brooklyn ultimately must become the most populous city in the country--as well as one occupying the greatest extent of territory. Her position alongside the great commercial city of the Western World, and the advantages she offers for residences to those doing business in the metropolis, must, in point of population at least, place her at the head of American cities.

docs.abstract: His explanation of the "damned hot" slander
docs.lead_paragraph: The Baptist State Convention is to be held at Elmira, on the 8th of October. The Eric Railroad and the People's Line of steamboats will transport Delegates both ways for one fare. Rev. R. M. S. Pease has resigned his pastoral charge of the Baptist Church in Kingston, N.Y.

docs.lead_paragraph: --Father MATHEW's efforts in Troy in the cause of Temperance, have been very successful. It is said that he has received 4,000 pledges. --There was a heavy frost Tuesday night in the vicinity of Boston. --The now water-works at Albany operate finely. They were tried on Monday, and a hight or seventy feet was attained with a single strean.

docs.lead_paragraph: One of the greatest benefactors of the human family that out favored country has ever entertained, is about to leave us and to return to his native land to die, after a life devoted to the poor, the afflicted and the friendless.
docs.snippet: One of the greatest benefactors of the human family that out favored country has ever entertained, is about to leave us and to return to his native land to die, after a life devoted to the poor, the afflicted and the friendless.

headline.main: An Appeal to the American Public, in Behalf of the Very Rev. Father Mathew.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: The remains of this distinguished American citizen were this day consigned to their final resting-place. It seems but yesterday he was walking our streets, with his usual military step, gentlemanly appearance and erect figure, the picture of health; and I can hardly realize that he now sleeps with his fathers. The funeral was appointed at 3 1/2 o'clock.

docs.lead_paragraph: The first new rice of the season, was received at Savannah, on the 17th inst., from a plantation on the Savannah River. The bar of Rochester held a meeting on Saturday, to honor the memory of the late Judge Whitlesey, Hon. S. L. Sebten, one of the Justices of the Supreme Court, presided.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U. S. Mail steamship Cherokee, Capt. WINDLE, arrived at this port yesterday afternoon, from Havana on the 17th inst. The news is not important. The island was perfectly quiet, and the prospects of business were improving.
docs.snippet: The U. S. Mail steamship Cherokee, Capt. WINDLE, arrived at this port yesterday afternoon, from Havana on the 17th inst. The news is not important. The island was perfectly quiet, and the prospects of business were improving.

headline.main: LATER FROM CUBA.; Arrival of the Cherokee--More Americans Captured--Quiet Restored.

docs.lead_paragraph: We have received by the Illinois advices from Oregon City to the 5th of August. Emigrants still continued to pour in. The Oregon Spectator mentions the arrival, on the 1st., of Mr. F. L. RAYMOND, of Indiana, one of a company of packers.

docs.lead_paragraph: EXTRAORDINARY MUSICAL PRODIGY.--Count Orlow has just presented to the Emperor of Russia, an extraordinary musical phenomenon, in the person of a young Wallachian, called Frederick Roltz. This man has been born with four hands, each having five fingers.
